title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: The sleep-debt-tracker project is a web application built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML that helps users visualize and manage their accumulated sleep debt. This project serves as a practical demonstration of utilizing TypeScript in a front-end development environment and explores concepts related to time management and data visualization.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to implement a secure and user-friendly voting application. This repository contains the source code for the entire project, focusing on providing a robust and modern solution for online voting systems. The project aims to explore best practices in web development while delivering a practical tool for managing and conducting votes.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository provides a web-based interface, built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS, for monitoring and controlling robotic fleets. This project offers a comprehensive dashboard solution for visualizing robot status, managing tasks, and gaining insights into fleet operations, fitting under the broad topic of project-based software development.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project utilizing HTML and Python to create interactive and informative map visualizations. This repository focuses on demonstrating how to leverage geographic data and present it in a visually appealing and understandable format, exploring the intersection of data science and web development.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a Python-based CRUD application built with Flask, PostgreSQL, HTML, and CSS. This project demonstrates the creation of a full-stack web application, showcasing the integration of backend logic with a user interface for performing Create, Read, Update, and Delete operations on data stored in a PostgreSQL database, making it a practical example for learning web development with Python.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a project built using TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript that provides a visual platform for organizing and brainstorming project ideas. This repository serves as a digital whiteboard to capture, categorize, and prioritize concepts, fostering collaboration and efficient project planning. It's designed to be a flexible and user-friendly tool for individuals and teams to manage their creative workflows.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project showcasing a modern dashboard implementation using Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. It serves as a practical example for building robust and visually appealing web applications, demonstrating best practices for front-end architecture, component design, and data handling within a Next.js environment. This repository provides a solid foundation for learning and building your own custom dashboards and data-driven applications.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven v2 is a project utilizing TypeScript and JavaScript to [insert project's primary function/goal, e.g., build a modern web application, develop a reusable UI component library, etc.]. This repository encompasses the core codebase and related resources for [further elaborate on the project, e.g., managing data, rendering user interfaces, or implementing specific features]. Focused on [mention specific area of focus or methodology, e.g., performance, maintainability, or test-driven development], Raven v2 aims to provide a [describe intended outcome or deliverable, e.g., robust, efficient, and scalable solution, comprehensive set of tools, etc.].

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. Built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and shell scripts, it provides an intuitive interface for filtering, searching, and understanding ROS log data to aid in debugging and performance analysis. This project falls under the broader topic of ROS development and tooling.

This project, built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML, explores various aspects related to its core topic. It serves as a demonstration and experimentation ground, offering a practical implementation leveraging modern web development technologies to address key challenges and concepts within the defined project scope.

title: resume
description: This repository houses the source code for my resume, generated using LaTeX for professional formatting and styling. The resume can also be rendered as HTML for online viewing and accessibility. This project serves as a showcase of my skills and experience, and is categorized under the "project" topic for easy reference.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a project leveraging TypeScript, CSS, JavaScript, and HTML to build an Express.js application that interfaces with the Gemini API. Built with Vite.js, this repository showcases a practical implementation for interacting with the Gemini API, providing a foundation for AI-powered conversational interfaces and other creative applications.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: Dynamic-event-calendar is a project built using JavaScript, CSS, and HTML to create a responsive and interactive event calendar. This repository focuses on implementing dynamic features to display, manage, and interact with events in a user-friendly calendar interface. It aims to provide a customizable and extendable solution for integrating event scheduling and display into web applications.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: iot-asset-tracking is a Next.js project built with TypeScript, TailwindCSS, and Supabase for tracking IoT assets. This repository provides a foundation for developing a robust and scalable asset management solution with a focus on real-time data visualization and efficient backend integration. The project leverages modern web development practices and technologies for a streamlined and maintainable codebase.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository contains Jupyter Notebooks implementing various finance-related projects using Python. It explores topics such as portfolio optimization, risk management, and financial modeling, leveraging Python libraries for data analysis and visualization to provide practical applications in the finance domain.

title: atg-world
description: The atg-world repository houses a web-based project built using TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. This project focuses on [briefly describe the project's purpose - e.g., creating a dynamic interactive world map, building a simulation game, etc.]. It leverages these technologies to deliver [mention key features or functionality - e.g., a user-friendly interface, real-time data visualization, engaging gameplay, etc.].

title: devboard
description: Devboard is a project built with Next.js 14 (using the pages router) and TypeScript, designed as a customizable development dashboard. It leverages MUI for its UI components, React Query for efficient data fetching, and modern CSS and JavaScript techniques to provide a robust and user-friendly experience. This repository serves as a template and learning resource for developers looking to build similar web applications with these technologies.

title: fruit-seller
description: fruit-seller is a modern e-commerce project built with Next.js 14, TypeScript, and JavaScript, leveraging the Pages Router. It utilizes MUI for a responsive and user-friendly interface and employs React Query for efficient data fetching and caching. This project demonstrates best practices for building type-safe and scalable web applications with a focus on e-commerce functionality.
